summary: Email chain among US Attorney's Office (USANYS) personnel discussing the logistics of providing a clean laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for discovery review in her case, referencing a similar arrangement in the Avenatti case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; the US Attorney's Office is seeking to provide her with a laptop for discovery review while she is incarcerated at MDC.

events.title: Discussion of laptop provision for Maxwell
events.description: Email correspondence among US Attorney's Office personnel regarding the process to provide a clean laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC for reviewing discovery materials in her case.

keyFacts: The US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was coordinating to provide a clean laptop to Ghislaine Maxwell while she was held at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).
The laptop was intended solely for discovery review, with capabilities limited to viewing standard file types (Word, PDF, .tif, .xls, etc.).
The office referenced a similar arrangement previously made in the Avenatti case as a precedent.
The correspondence indicates logistical concerns, including confirming MDC/BOP policies on inmate laptop use and sourcing the necessary hardware.
